title: AI Literacy Competency Enhancement Program for Pre-Service Mathematics Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational mathematics education methodologies and basic digital device proficiency
context.additional_context: LMS environment supporting smartphone-based learning, providing asynchronous materials and mobile-optimized content

learning_goals: Utilizing AI-based math problem-solving tools (GeoGebra, Wolfram Alpha, etc.), learners draft three+ lesson plans. Within a six-month course, they develop instructional materials meeting four or more of five evaluation criteria (educational effectiveness, technology integration, creativity, practicality, accessibility) based on peer reviews and expert evaluations.

Learners can analyze three or more educational AI platforms (e.g., Khan Academy, Duolingo) and propose two or more lesson design plans applicable to elementary school mathematics curriculum (fractions, equations, etc.) that meet at least 2 out of 3 points on a rubric evaluation criteria (clarity, feasibility, innovativeness).

Learners can create visualized materials (images/videos) for three or more secondary mathematics concepts (functions, geometry, statistics, etc.) using generative AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, MidJourney, GeoGebra AI) and produce a report achieving a 'B' grade or higher in at least four out of five peer assessment rubric items.
Foster the ability to develop math educational materials incorporating AI ethics and bias review criteria.

resources: AI Educational Tool Trial Web Application
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
